edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.utilities.flashcards

Class DeckStudyController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.utilities.flashcards.DeckStudyController

  • public class DeckStudyController
extends Object
    Controller for a deck and a DeckStudy User Interface.
    Author:
    Chad Simmons and Shany Yeshanov

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeckStudyController(DeckStudyUI ui, Deck deck)
      Construct a new DeckStudyController to manage a given user interface and deck.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flipCard()
      Flip the current card to display the back side.
      void nextCard()
      View the next card in the deck.
      void shuffleDeck()
      Shuffle the deck and draw/view the top card after shuffling.
      void updateUI()
      Update the user interface with the text of the current card's state and position.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeckStudyController

        public DeckStudyController(DeckStudyUI ui,
                           Deck deck)
        Construct a new DeckStudyController to manage a given user interface and deck. If there are no cards in the deck a default message will appear.
        Parameters:
        ui - The user interface which communicates with the controller.
        deck - The deck of cards being studied.

    • Method Detail

      • flipCard

        public void flipCard()
        Flip the current card to display the back side. This will update the user interface with the text on the back of the card.

      • nextCard

        public void nextCard()
        View the next card in the deck. The current card will be placed on the bottom. This method signals the UI to update its display.

      • shuffleDeck

        public void shuffleDeck()
        Shuffle the deck and draw/view the top card after shuffling. This method signals the UI to update its display.

      • updateUI

        public void updateUI()
        Update the user interface with the text of the current card's state and position.
